CIPHER.0.cipherString: Ay, sir; to be honest, as this world goes, is to be one man picked out of ten thousand.
CIPHER.0.question: Solve this aristocrat.

CIPHER.1.cipherString: Do not abandon yourselves to despair. We are the Easter people and hallelujah is our song.
CIPHER.1.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters H and D map to A and S.

CIPHER.2.cipherString: Write what you love. Love will hold you through the hard times and hold the world during the good times.
CIPHER.2.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters Q and Z map to M and N.

CIPHER.3.cipherString: Great ability develops and reveals itself increasingly with every new assignment.
CIPHER.3.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters R and D map to M and O.

CIPHER.4.cipherString: Here is the test to find whether your mission on Earth is finished: if you're alive, it isn't.
CIPHER.4.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters Q and Y map to L and V.

CIPHER.5.cipherString: If anyone counts upon oneday ahead or even more, he does not think. For there can be no tomorrow until we have safely passed the day that is with us still.
CIPHER.5.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters W and X map to C and R.

CIPHER.6.cipherString: In 'Next to Normal,' I had millions of breakdowns and panic attacks, but nobody ever heard about those.
CIPHER.6.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters Y and N map to H and Q.

CIPHER.7.cipherString: Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding about ourselves.
CIPHER.7.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters Z and R map to C and W.

CIPHER.8.cipherString: Writing long hand is the last refuge. One needs the time it takes to put pencil to paper and let it run along the ruled line.
CIPHER.8.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters W and L map to H and O.

CIPHER.9.cipherString: I've been writing stories since I was a kid. I love writing stories.
CIPHER.9.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters U and C map to C and W.

CIPHER.10.cipherString: God our Lord would have us look to the Giver and love Him more than His gift, keeping Him always before our eyes, in our hearts, and in our thoughts.
CIPHER.10.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters P and R map to B and T.

CIPHER.11.cipherString: You can't even begin to understand biology, you can't understand life, unless you understand what it's all there for, how it arose - and that means evolution.
CIPHER.11.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters Q and E map to J and Z.

CIPHER.12.cipherString: Individuals can spend their money more wisely, efficiently and more humanely than can government.
CIPHER.12.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters S and V map to L and W.

CIPHER.13.cipherString: You are defined by who you are, by your choices in life, in all regards, not just in doing movies.
CIPHER.13.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters F and U map to H and Y.

CIPHER.14.cipherString: You become a better writer by writing. You become a better travel writer by writing about travel.
CIPHER.14.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters A and Z map to H and Y.

CIPHER.15.cipherString: Richard Childress and myself have made some important innovations on our cars.
CIPHER.15.question: Decode this sentence which has been encoded with an Affine cipher. The letters A and E map to E and O.
